text: Poundbury is a new town outside of Dorchester in the county of Dorset, England. It is an experiment town built by prize-winning architect LÃ©on Krier. It was planned and supported by Charles, Prince of Wales, on whose land it is built on (Duchy of Cornwall). Its design is based on New Urbanist ideas. It is set to be finished in 2025. Around 6,000 people will live here. ==References== Category:Towns in Dorset
title: Poundbury
